#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Concorde crash trial begins
#Text=Wednesday , February 3 , 2010
#Text=Concorde , a joint Anglo - French project , withdrawn from service in 2003 .
#Text=A French court Tuesday launched the trial of five men and a US airline over the Concorde disaster .
#Text=113 people were killed when the supersonic jet struck a hotel near Paris in 2000 .

#Text=The prosecution case agrees with the facts set out in the final accident report , which , by international law , was written from an entirely different investigation and thus cannot be introduced in court .

#Text=It alleges that improper maintenance of an American airliner and failure to detect design flaws with the Concorde were responsible for the Air France jet 's crash , to an extent that makes the six defendants guilty of involuntary manslaughter .
#Text=Both official investigations found that a Continental Airlines McDonnell Douglas DC-10 had taken off five minutes before Concorde with an improvised repair .
#Text=A metal strip had been machined by mechanics instead of using a certified part .
#Text=This strip dropped off the aircraft , leaving a 43cm ( 17in ) piece of titanium on the runway .
#Text=Prosecutors and investigators concluded that as Concorde struck the part on takeoff a tyre burst and ripped apart , sending chunks of rubber flying .
#Text=A large piece slammed into the underside of the wing hard enough to trigger a pressure wave that ruptured the fuel tank .
#Text=Damaged wiring is believed to have been responsible for igniting this , creating a trailing fireball as the aircraft took off bound for New York .

#Text=Concorde 's pilots attempted to circle round for an emergency landing back at Charles de Gaulle Airport , but instead struck a hotel approximately three kilometres ( two miles ) from the airport .
#Text=All 109 passengers and crew were on board , as well as four people in the hotel , were killed .
#Text=The majority of victims were Germans heading to meet up with a cruise liner for a Caribbean holiday , the remainder of the 100 passengers were from Austria .
#Text=John Taylor , the Continental mechanic who is alleged to have built and fitted the nonstandard part , and his boss Stanley Ford , have been targeted for prosecution .
#Text=Both individuals and their employer deny responsibility .
#Text=Also charged are two members of the UK-French firm behind Concorde - Aérospatiale , who have since merged into Airbus parent EADS .

#Text=Henri Perrier was head of testing for Concorde and the aircraft 's chief engineer was Jacques Herubel ; both have been charged for a perceived failure to locate and rectify design flaws with Concorde .
#Text=The former chief of civil aviation , Claude Frantzen , is facing charges on the same basis .
#Text=Each individual can be imprisoned for up to three years and fined up to € 50,900 ( US$ 71,000 .
#Text=Continental face a fine of up to € 375,000 ( US$ 520,000 ) .
#Text=The airline 's defence claims the part on the runway had no role to play in the accident .
#Text=TV channel Canal+ previously suggested the investigations and prosecution were a coverup of more serious issues with Concorde .
#Text=Nothing was allowed to disturb Air France [ ... ]
#Text=orders came from very high in the administration
#Text=— Michel Bourgeois , air accident investigator
#Text=The broadcast alleged Concorde erupted into flames long before getting as far down the runway as the strip .
#Text=Continental 's lawyers say they can call 28 witnesses to give similar evidence and told the Le Parisien that they would seek a dismissal of the charges today .
#Text=The case opened with judge Dominique Andreassier reading out every one of the 113 names of the deceased , followed by the charges against the six , in the court in Pontoise .
#Text=There are 80,000 pages of documents to be presented at trial , and 543 items are to be presented as evidence .
#Text=The case is split into 90 volumes and is expected to take four months .
#Text=The judge cautioned against losing touch with the human aspect of what is anticipated to be a very technical trial .
#Text=The estimated cost is expected to be in excess of 3 million Euro ( US$ 4.2 million ) .
#Text=The investigation found some contributory causes that can be linked to Air France .
#Text=Four days before the crash an important tyre spacer was left off the Concorde by mechanics , and the plane was overloaded .
#Text=The airport itself was also criticised for having cancelled a scheduled sweep of the runway .

#Text=Air France lawyer Fernand Garnault , an aviation specialist , was adamant that Continental did play the main role in the accident ; " [ i]t is clear that a piece from a Continental plane fell on the runway .

#Text=Few families are represented at the trial , because all the passengers struck a deal with Air France to accept compensation in exchange for waiving their right to take legal action , leaving only those killed in the hotel and the crew .

#Text=However , French group Fenvac are representing the families , and spokesman Stephane Gicquel said that the families would be observing keenly , that  [ t]his tragedy is part of their personal history and of their family history . "

column1: #Text=Captain Christian Marty 's family 's lawyer , Roland Rappaport , said outside court today that , " [ t]his accident should have been avoided .

#Text=Daniel Soulez Larivière , who represents Frantzen , said ,  this accident was unforeseeable , " and the original investigations should have agreed .

column1: #Text=Concorde suffered a string of similar incidents in the 1970s including one in Washington that came close to triggering a fire .
#Text=" They [ the authorities ] wanted to protect Concorde , the image of France that it projected .
